title: I'm starting a crusade against targeted/reliable burst damage.
body:
As a Vel'Koz main I think this game will only be truly fair when all champions can potentially miss their entire kit.

But I'll settle for simple number nerfs to point and click burst.

Reliable burst damage is a fair trade for being melee which most burst damage champs are. Velkoz has a major range advantage on most burst champs. So if players who use mages can properly hit their skills, they can beat burst champs.

The mobility is already so strong against a champ like Vel'koz that he can't duel any of those champs. The only reason he's viable is he can spam waveclear and then group with his team.

I agree that stuns should exist. I do not agree they need to be easy and reliable.

My main thing is what you said, long range point and click stuns.

I would even take that further and say that long range, large area hitting shots of any sort should also not exist. LIke fizz ult, zoe stun, zyra ult. Where as syndra stuns I don't have an issue with because they require setup and can be visually outplayed.
I'm really just saying they should nerf reliable and easy burst. If the champ can simply gap close across the screen and 100-0 a target with no counterplay, that's stupid.

Your first part in the post says something different.

On that I do agree unless the person is far ahead and against a target without a defensive item e.g. adcs.
As a Vel'Koz main, you should be happy about targetted cc/burst keeping mobile champs in check, while at the same time countering champs like Liss and Annie who use it with your range.
This is not the case when it's a mobile champ with reliable burst from items which is currently pretty much every mobile champ, regardless of whether it's AP or AD.
{{champion:45}} I agree. Just make my ult an aoe projectile that goes over minions and we are square.

Executes shouldn't be considered "reliable" though because first you have to get the target low. If you have a reliable means to achieve that condition, then the true offender is whatever reliable means you have to get them into execute range.
{{champion:1}}  how do you feel about annie q?

The ability by itself is not a huge offender because it's a low CD, low burst ability. The AP ratio is a little bit high but there are still many things that are more problematic.

Annie's kit as a whole is a moderate offender because her rotation is extremely clean and reliable. It's easy for her to instantly kill a target with almost no counterplay (tiny delays on W and R make them flashable but otherwise there's no much you can do) However, I only consider her kit as a whole a moderate offender because she has no built in mobility and low cast ranges, so positioning matters a lot for her and her opponents.

I find reliable burst to be more of a problem on champions with high mobility because there is basically no positioning based counterplay. Instead the counterplay has to be somewhere else. In a lot of those cases because of their item and rune options, it leaves me wondering where the counterplay is.

Ideally I wish Annie would get a small rework (think like Warwick's rework) but there are bigger problems.
